messages.text: <@U6A7NFP62> I think your reorganization of `server.jl` in SymbolServer.jl won't work, right now the whole indexing process in the extension is broken. In particular, we previously had the structure that the script itself was surrounded in a `module SymbolServer` and then inside we `include` all the source files that we need. The new version now attempts to `using SymbolServer`, and that in general won't work because `SymbolServer` is not going to be part of the environment in which `server.jl` is running. Was there a reason for this change? I'll try and see whether we can just go back to the old structure, right?

elements.text: I think your reorganization of
server.jl
in SymbolServer.jl won't work, right now the whole indexing process in the extension is broken. In particular, we previously had the structure that the script itself was surrounded in a
module SymbolServer
and then inside we
include
all the source files that we need. The new version now attempts to
using SymbolServer
, and that in general won't work because
SymbolServer
is not going to be part of the environment in which
server.jl
is running. Was there a reason for this change? I'll try and see whether we can just go back to the old structure, right?

messages.text: I found myself confused on which file to edit first. If I edit plotgallery, will it break ElectronDisplay? Any suggestions on which files I could start looking at in order to achieve our goal of making a separate webview and a panel?

elements.text: I found myself confused on which file to edit first. If I edit plotgallery, will it break ElectronDisplay? Any suggestions on which files I could start looking at in order to achieve our goal of making a separate webview and a panel?

messages.text: Ah right - no reason other than to tidy things.

elements.text: Ah right - no reason other than to tidy things.

messages.text: <@U01L42VSVBJ> I think we should leave plotgallery alone for ElectronDisplay.jl, and just do a new thing for the VS Code extension. Because things will be split between two webviews, the whole things will be pretty VS Code specific in any case, so I think trying to share code between those two projects would just be super painful. I would also say that we could try to do this without react this time, just to keep things simpler.

elements.text: I think we should leave plotgallery alone for ElectronDisplay.jl, and just do a new thing for the VS Code extension. Because things will be split between two webviews, the whole things will be pretty VS Code specific in any case, so I think trying to share code between those two projects would just be super painful. I would also say that we could try to do this without react this time, just to keep things simpler.

messages.text: Great! We are directly modifying the vscode extension repo without creating another one, right?

elements.text: Great! We are directly modifying the vscode extension repo without creating another one, right?

messages.text: yes
